channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: He didn't write the tax and spending bill, but it shares his vision for government
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with McKay Coppins, who recently profiled Russell Vought in the Atlantic. Vought is a key player in the Trump administration's push to remake the federal government.

item.title: The soccer world is heartbroken by the tragic death of Liverpool star Diogo Jota
item.description: Fans in Liverpool and beyond are heartbroken at the tragic death of 28-year-old star player Diogo Joga, who was killed in a car crash in Spain

item.title: President Trump wants to slash subsidies for small airports across rural America
item.description: More than 180 airports in rural areas across the U.S. benefit from federal funding that guarantees commercial air service. That program might lose half its funding due to Trump administration cuts.

item.title: Trump's reversal of Army base names shines light on military's segregationist past
item.description: The Trump administration restored the names of nine bases named after confederate general. Advocates say it dishonors a bi-partisan attempt to turn the page on the military's segregationist past.

item.title: CIA reviews report on Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. presidential election
item.description: President Trump's CIA Director John Ratcliffe tasked CIA analysts with reviewing the agency's 2016 conclusions about election interference.

item.title: Supreme Court to decide if states can ban transgender girls in sports
item.description: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear two cases in the fall that test state laws banning transgender women and girls from participating in sports at publicly funded institutions.

item.title: More than 70 writers send open letter about AI to literary publishers
item.description: More than 70 writers wrote an open letter outlining their issues with the use of A.I. in the literary world. Their main demand is for publishing houses to never release books created by machines.

item.title: Pentagon says it's pausing some military aid to Ukraine amid new attacks from Russia
item.description: The Pentagon is halting the delivery of some U.S. weapons to Ukraine that are crucial in its battle against Russia. This comes at a time when Russia has stepped up its attacks against Ukraine.

item.title: How GOP lawmakers pulled off the megabill â€” and what it means for the American people
item.description: The House of Representatives has passed the One Big Beautiful Bill. The package extends existing temporary tax cuts, makes cuts to Medicaid and adds spending on border security and defense.

item.title: DNC chair says Republicans sold 'their constituents out to help billionaires'
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Ken Martin, chairman of the Democratic National Committee, about how Trump's massive tax and policy bill will figure into democratic messaging in the midterms.
